data.title: 5 Key Insights Into Venus Williams' Sister's Career
data.meta_description: Isha Price is an American former professional tennis player. She is the younger sister of Venus and Serena Williams. Price was born in Saginaw, Michigan, on September 18, 1975. She began playing tennis at the age of four. She turned professional in 1994 and reached a career-high singles ranking of world No. 29 in 1998.
data.text:
Isha Price is an American former professional tennis player. She is the younger sister of Venus and Serena Williams.

Price was born in Saginaw, Michigan, on September 18, 1975. She began playing tennis at the age of four. She turned professional in 1994 and reached a career-high singles ranking of world No. 29 in 1998. Price won one WTA singles title, the Croatian Bol Ladies Open in 1997. She also won two WTA doubles titles, both with her sister Venus.

Price retired from professional tennis in 2002. She has since worked as a tennis commentator and coach. She is also the founder of the Isha Price Tennis Academy.

Isha Price

Isha Price is a former professional tennis player and the younger sister of Venus and Serena Williams. Here are 5 key aspects of her life and career:

Birthplace: Saginaw, Michigan

Birthdate: September 18, 1975

Career-high singles ranking: World No. 29

WTA singles titles: 1

WTA doubles titles: 2 (both with Venus Williams)

Price began playing tennis at the age of four and turned professional in 1994. She won her only WTA singles title in 1997 at the Croatian Bol Ladies Open. She also won two WTA doubles titles, both with her sister Venus. Price retired from professional tennis in 2002 and has since worked as a tennis commentator and coach. She is also the founder of the Isha Price Tennis Academy.

Price is a talented tennis player who has achieved success both on and off the court. She is a role model for young tennis players and an inspiration to her fans.

Birthplace

Isha Price was born in Saginaw, Michigan, on September 18, 1975. Her birthplace is significant for several reasons:

Family Roots: Saginaw is also the birthplace of her older sisters, Venus and Serena Williams. The city has a rich tennis history, and the Williams family has been instrumental in its development.

Early Training: Price began playing tennis at the age of four at the Saginaw YMCA. The city provided her with access to quality coaching and training facilities, which helped her develop her skills.

Community Support: Saginaw has been a supportive community for Price and her family. The city has hosted several tennis tournaments and events, and the local community has always been behind her.

Inspiration: Price has said that growing up in Saginaw inspired her to pursue a career in tennis. She has credited the city's tennis community and her family's support for her success.

Price's birthplace has played a significant role in her life and career. Saginaw is where she developed her love of tennis and where she received the support she needed to succeed. The city will always be a special place for her.

Birthdate

Isha Price's birthdate, September 18, 1975, holds significance in understanding her life and career as a tennis player and her relationship with her sisters, Venus and Serena Williams.

Family Legacy: Price was born into a family with a strong tennis legacy. Her older sisters, Venus and Serena, are two of the greatest tennis players of all time. Price's birthdate places her in the middle of her sisters' careers, and she has benefited from their guidance and support throughout her life.

Early Development: Price began playing tennis at the age of four, and her birthdate indicates that she was exposed to the sport from a young age. This early exposure helped her develop her skills and passion for tennis.

Sibling Rivalry and Support: Price's birthdate also shaped her relationship with her sisters. Being younger than Venus and Serena, she often played the role of the "little sister" and had to compete with them for attention and resources. However, her sisters have also been her biggest supporters, and they have helped her achieve her own success in tennis.

Career Timeline: Price's birthdate influenced the trajectory of her career. She turned professional in 1994, at the age of 19. This was a relatively late start for a professional tennis player, but it allowed her to benefit from the experience and knowledge of her older sisters.

Overall, Isha Price's birthdate, September 18, 1975, is a significant factor in her life and career. It shaped her family relationships, her exposure to tennis, and the trajectory of her professional journey.

Career-high singles ranking

Isha Price achieved a career-high singles ranking of World No. 29 in 1998. This ranking is a testament to her talent and hard work as a professional tennis player. It also highlights her position among the top players in the world during that time.

Skill and Consistency: Achieving a top-30 ranking requires a high level of skill and consistency. Price's ranking indicates that she was able to perform at a consistently high level throughout the season, competing against the best players in the world.

Tournament Success: Price's ranking was likely influenced by her success in various tournaments. She won one WTA singles title and two WTA doubles titles, both with her sister Venus. These victories contributed to her ranking points and helped her climb up the rankings.

Competition Level: The level of competition in women's tennis was extremely high during the late 1990s and early 2000s. Price's ranking of World No. 29 placed her among the top players in a competitive era, which makes her achievement even more impressive.

Sibling Rivalry and Support: Price's ranking was also influenced by her relationship with her older sisters, Venus and Serena Williams. Venus was ranked World No. 1 during much of Price's career, and Serena was also a top-ranked player. This sibling rivalry pushed Price to improve her game and strive for excellence.

Overall, Isha Price's career-high singles ranking of World No. 29 is a reflection of her talent, hard work, and the competitive environment in which she played. It is a significant achievement in her career and a testament to her status as one of the top tennis players in the world during that time.

WTA singles titles

Isha Price won one WTA singles title during her professional tennis career. This title came at the Croatian Bol Ladies Open in 1997. Winning a WTA singles title is a significant achievement, as it requires a player to perform at a consistently high level throughout the tournament. It also demonstrates a player's ability to handle the pressure of competing against top-ranked opponents.

Price's WTA singles title is an important component of her overall biography and career achievements. It is one of the key facts that helps to define her as a successful tennis player. The title also serves as a reminder of her talent and hard work, and it inspires other aspiring tennis players to strive for their own success.

In conclusion, Isha Price's WTA singles title is a significant achievement that reflects her talent, hard work, and dedication to the sport of tennis. It is a key part of her overall biography and career, and it serves as an inspiration to other aspiring tennis players.

WTA doubles titles

Isha Price won two WTA doubles titles during her professional tennis career, both with her sister Venus Williams. These titles came at the Croatian Bol Ladies Open in 1997 and the ASB Classic in 1998. Winning a WTA doubles title is a significant achievement, as it requires a player to have a high level of skill and coordination with their partner. It also demonstrates a player's ability to work well as a team and to handle the pressure of competing against top-ranked opponents.

Price's WTA doubles titles are an important component of her overall biography and career achievements. They are one of the key facts that help to define her as a successful tennis player. The titles also serve as a reminder of her close relationship with her sister Venus, and they inspire other aspiring tennis players to strive for their own success.

In conclusion, Isha Price's WTA doubles titles are a significant achievement that reflects her talent, hard work, and dedication to the sport of tennis. They are a key part of her overall biography and career, and they serve as an inspiration to other aspiring tennis players.
